title: Mississippi Landlord-Tenant Law Reference
disclaimer: This is informational only and does not constitute legal advice. Consult a licensed attorney for legal guidance.

residentialLandlordTenantAct.name: Mississippi Residential Landlord and Tenant Act
residentialLandlordTenantAct.appliesTo: All residential rental properties in Mississippi

89-8-3.title: Definitions
89-8-3.summary: Defines key terms including 'landlord', 'tenant', 'premises', 'rent', and 'security deposit'

89-8-7.title: Security Deposits
keyPoints: May not exceed one month's rent
Must be returned within 45 days of lease termination
Written itemized list required for deductions
May not withhold for normal wear and tear
Must deposit in financial institution or post bond

89-8-9.title: Disclosure of Information
89-8-9.summary: Landlord must disclose name and address for service of process

89-8-15.title: Landlord Obligations
89-8-15.summary: Landlords must maintain premises in habitable condition
tenantRights: Right to working plumbing, heating, and electrical systems
Right to notice before landlord entry (except emergencies)

89-8-19.title: Landlord's Right of Access
89-8-19.summary: Landlord may enter with tenant consent or 48 hours notice

89-8-23.title: Tenant Obligations
89-8-23.summary: Tenants must pay rent, keep premises clean, and comply with lease terms

89-8-25.title: Tenant's Remedies for Landlord's Noncompliance
89-8-25.summary: Tenant remedies when landlord fails to maintain premises
remedies: May terminate lease if not cured
May use repair and deduct remedy

89-8-27.title: Termination by Landlord for Tenant's Noncompliance
89-8-27.summary: Landlord may terminate for tenant violations

89-8-31.title: Retaliatory Conduct Prohibited
89-8-31.summary: Landlord cannot retaliate for tenant exercising legal rights
protectedActivities: Exercising legal rights under lease or law

89-8-33.title: Recovery of Possession
89-8-33.summary: Landlord must use judicial process to evict

unlawfulDetainer.name: Unlawful Detainer Proceedings
unlawfulDetainer.summary: Legal process for landlord to recover possession of rental property
keyPoints: Filed in County Court or Justice Court
Must state grounds for eviction
Hearing within 14 days of service
Judgment for possession if tenant fails to appear or defend
5-day appeal period
Writ of possession after appeal period expires

selfHelpEviction.name: Self-Help Eviction Prohibition
selfHelpEviction.summary: Landlords cannot use self-help methods to remove tenants

retaliatoryEviction.name: Retaliatory Eviction Protection
retaliatoryEviction.summary: Landlord cannot evict in retaliation for tenant exercising legal rights
protectedActivities: Exercising rights under lease or law

noticePeriods.name: Required Notice Periods
noticePeriods.summary: Minimum notice periods required under Mississippi law

nonpayment.notes: Very short - tenant must act immediately

leaseViolation.notes: Must specify the nature of the violation

illegalActivity.notes: For drug or criminal activity on premises

courtSystem.name: Mississippi Court System for Landlord-Tenant
courtSystem.summary: Two court options for eviction proceedings

justiceCourt.name: Justice Court
justiceCourt.jurisdiction: Eviction cases regardless of rent amount

countyCourt.name: County Court
countyCourt.description: Higher court option in some counties
countyCourt.jurisdiction: Eviction cases and damages up to $200,000

municipalCourt.name: Municipal Court
municipalCourt.description: Some cities handle evictions in municipal court
municipalCourt.note: Check with local court for procedures

appeals.name: Appeal Rights
keyPoints: 5 calendar days to file appeal
Must post appeal bond
Appeal heard in Circuit Court
De novo trial available

securityDeposits.name: Security Deposit Law
keyPoints: Maximum one month's rent
Must return within 45 days of lease termination
Must provide itemized list of deductions
Cannot deduct for normal wear and tear
Wrongful withholding = tenant may sue for deposit plus damages

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 3-day written notice
defenses.howToRaise: File answer alleging insufficient notice; request dismissal

defenses.description: All rent due was paid within the 3-day notice period
defenses.howToRaise: Provide receipts showing payment before deadline

defenses.description: Premises not maintained in habitable condition
defenses.howToRaise: Document conditions; show landlord was notified; may offset rent
Review lease terms; challenge improper fees

defenses.description: Eviction filed in response to tenant exercising legal rights
defenses.howToRaise: Show timing between protected activity and eviction filing

defenses.description: Landlord failed to properly handle security deposit
defenses.howToRaise: May use as offset against rent owed

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 30-day written notice
defenses.howToRaise: File answer alleging insufficient notice period

defenses.description: Tenant cured the violation within 30-day period
defenses.howToRaise: Document compliance; show violation was remedied

defenses.description: Alleged violation did not occur or does not violate lease
defenses.howToRaise: Review lease terms; present evidence disproving violation

defenses.description: Landlord enforces provision against tenant but not others
Landlord breached lease before alleged tenant violation
Landlord failed to provide required 30-day notice

defenses.howToRaise: Show acceptance of rent after lease end

hinds.name: Mississippi Center for Legal Services - Jackson

harrison.name: Mississippi Center for Legal Services - Gulfport

courtSystems.general: Justice Court or County Court handles eviction cases
courtSystems.appeals: Circuit Court hears appeals within 5 days

tenantProtectionNotes: 3-day notice for non-payment is very short - act immediately
